question: Which of the following statements about the Gupta Empire under Samudragupta is NOT correct?
option1: Prayaga Prashasti of Samudragupta composed by his court poet Harisena is engraved on an Ashokan pillar at Allahabad.
option2: Samudragupta was the first Gupta ruler to have exercised direct administrative control over western and Southern India.
option3: Samudragupta carved out an extensive empire which is evident from the fact that he had performed an Asvamedha sacrifice.
answer: Samudragupta was the first Gupta ruler to have exercised direct administrative control over western and Southern India.
explanation: Samudragupta was the first Gupta ruler to have exercised direct administrative control over western and Southern India.
